question: What is the name of the act that incorporates the rights set out in the European Convention on Human Rights into British law?
oriSent: The Human Rights Act 1998 is the piece of legislation that incorporates the rights set out in the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) into domestic British law.

question: What came into force in the UK in October?
oriSent: The Act came into force in the UK in October The ECHR was drafted by the newly formed Council of Europe in Rome on 4 November The convention aimed to achieve greater international unity in recognising the equal rights of men and women, and to incorporate the traditions of civil liberty.
